summary: This is an email from July 18, 2021, discussing the discovery of two additional FedEx records related to the Epstein case. The email notes specific pages within PDF attachments where a package to an individual (likely a victim or witness) is documented and mentions the involvement of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Mentioned as the recipient of the correspondence at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. Her contact information is provided.

events.title: Email Regarding FedEx Records Discovery
events.description: An email is sent discussing the discovery of two additional FedEx records relevant to the Epstein case, with specific references to PDF attachments.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Two additional FedEx records were identified in July 2021, indicating ongoing document review in the Epstein investigation.
The records include a package sent to an individual (name not provided in the excerpt), referenced on specific pages of attached PDFs.
The correspondence is directed to Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The email suggests the records were flagged as 'hot' or significant within the document set.
